creditline: The Modernism Collection, gift of Norwest Bank Minnesota
description: Chromium-plated steel with ebonized wood tops
dimension: 23 5/8 x 27 1/2 x 15 1/4 in. (60 x 69.8 x 38.7 cm) (largest table)
text: Smaller tables are concealed within larger ones in this nest of tables, and can be pulled out at a moment’s notice. The tables are primarily made of tubular steel, a highly innovative material at the time and easier to bend than wood. Originally intended as stools, these tables were a favorite design of Breuer’s: simple, functional, space-saving, and inexpensive.
title: Table from a nest of tables
